comments:
To duplicate this exception, create a repository location in the CVS
Perspective. Use an unqualified host name on your network ("acme" instead of
"acme.company.com"). Then remove the DNS suffix of your Network Interface, so
that "acme" no longer resolves to a valid host ("acme.company.com"). Close and
re-open Eclipse. Try to open the branches or HEAD to browse the tree. You should
get an UnkonwnHostException. The result is that the Tree Viewer loses all
elements of its display. 

I found the problem in 3.0M4, but I have not done any investigation to see if it
exists in previous 3.0 builds. 

The exception I found:

I am unable to reproduce this using I20031113 on Windows XP. We'll have to 
test it on Win 2000 to ensure it's not a platform specific problem.

This works for me using M5 on Win 2000 (i.e. connection fails but there is no 
NPE).
